laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Initial tests for EBV-DNA and anemia
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression to moderate anemia (Hb: 60-80g/L) and thrombocytopenia (Plt: 30-70 × 10^9/L), continuously positive EBV-DNA.

laboratory_examinations.findings: WBC: 3.4 × 10^9/L, NE: 0.68 × 10^9/L, Hb: 68g/L, Plt: 55 × 10^9/L, LDH: 305 U/L, albumin: 32.8 g/L, triglyceride: 1.93 mmol/L, ferritin: 1440 ng/mL, fibrinogen: 1.93 g/L, EBV-DNA level: 5.01 × 10^4 IU/mL, soluble CD25: > 44000 U/ml, NK cell activity: 7.45%.

Initially showed normal cell morphology; later revealed significantly active hyperplasia of nucleated cells, occasional hemophagocytic events, and immature abnormal hematopoietic elements. MUNC13-4 (UNC13D) expression was lower than in normal controls.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial tests showed normal morphology; subsequent tests indicated progression to significant abnormalities.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Routine, biochemical and morphological examination of cerebrospinal fluid was negative.
Revealed mild insufficiency of the mitral and tricuspid valves.
Showed slight enhancement of intrahepatic echoes, thickening of gallbladder wall, and splenomegaly.
